tier_1_determinative.making_any_preparation_to_commit_dacoity: Yes, the accused were found assembling with the intention to commit dacoity, as evidenced by the informant's report and their conversation about reducing the crowd and keeping weapons ready.

tier_2_material.nature_of_preparation: The accused were observed planning the dacoity in Zhaveri Bazar, with specific instructions to wait until the crowd reduced and to keep weapons ready.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abdul @ Aslam Salim Shaikh vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: IPC 399, IPC 402, Section 4 r/w Section 25 of the Arms Act
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code Sections 399, 402; Arms Act Section 4 r/w Section 25

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellant was not found in possession of any weapon and the prosecution failed to prove any notification under Section 4 of the Arms Act for the area in question. The appellant's conviction under the Arms Act was set aside, but the conviction under IPC sections 399 and 402 was maintained.
